sentences: Mariana Espósito was born on October 10, 1991, in Buenos Aires, Argentina to Carlos Espósito, a football coach, and Maria José Riera, who road-manages her tours.
section: == Life and career == | === 1991—2003: Early life and career: Rincón de Luz ===

sentences: She has two older siblings, Ana Laura, a makeup artist and stylist, and Patricio Espósito, a former futsal player who played in Italy.
section: == Life and career == | === 1991—2003: Early life and career: Rincón de Luz ===

sentences: Espósito lived in the Buenos Aires neighbourhood of Parque Patricios during her childhood and then moved to the district of Banfield, Buenos Aires.
section: == Life and career == | === 1991—2003: Early life and career: Rincón de Luz ===

sentences: Espósito is of Italian descent through her great-grandparents.
section: == Life and career == | === 1991—2003: Early life and career: Rincón de Luz ===

sentences: Espósito made her television debut at the age of 6 on the children's program Caramelito y Vos in 1998, as a contestant impersonating Uruguayan actress and singer Natalia Oreiro.
section: == Life and career == | === 1991—2003: Early life and career: Rincón de Luz ===

sentences: After wandering into a producer Cris Morena audition by mistake in early 2002, Espósito was cast in Morena's children television series Rincón de Luz, making her acting debut as part of the children's supporting cast, portraying Malena "Coco" Cabrera.
section: == Life and career == | === 1991—2003: Early life and career: Rincón de Luz ===

sentences: Rincón de Luz ran on Argentina's Canal 9 and later América TV from February 18, 2003, to December 18, 2003.
section: == Life and career == | === 1991—2003: Early life and career: Rincón de Luz ===

sentences: Espósito also made her singing debut in the Rincón de Luz soundtrack album, singing a duet with Agustín Sierra.
section: == Life and career == | === 1991—2003: Early life and career: Rincón de Luz ===

sentences: Due to Rincón de Luz's success in Israel, Espósito was part of a stage adaptation at the Yad Eliyahu Arena in Tel Aviv, which ran for two weeks in April, 2004.

section: == Life and career == | === 2020—2021: Libra and Sky Rojo ===
== Life and career == | === 2020—2021: Libra and Sky Rojo ===

sentences: The year 2020 saw the release of Lali's fourth studio album titled Libra, which reached the number one position in Argentina.
section: == Life and career == | === 2020—2021: Libra and Sky Rojo ===

sentences: The album was preceded by the release of three more singles, namely "Lo Que Tengo Yo", "Fascinada" and "Ladrón" with Argentine trap singer Cazzu.
section: == Life and career == | === 2020—2021: Libra and Sky Rojo ===

sentences: 2020 was also marked by collaborations as Lali was featured in Los Ángeles Azules's "Las Maravillas de La Vida", Fito Páez's "Gente en la Calle" and the Dvicio-duet "Soy de Volar".
section: == Life and career == | === 2020—2021: Libra and Sky Rojo ===

sentences: Lali was also part of the charity single "Color Esperanza 2020" alongside Diego Torres, Thalía, Camilo, Carlos Vives, Manuel Turizo, Rauw Alejandro, Ivete Sangalo and others.
section: == Life and career == | === 2020—2021: Libra and Sky Rojo ===

sentences: The song was released as a joint effort by Sony Music Latin and Global Citizen to benefit the Pan American Health Organization's (PAHO) response to the COVID-19 pandemic.2020 was also marked by the shooting of the upcoming Netflix series, Sky Rojo, for which Lali had to move indefinitely to Spain.
section: == Life and career == | === 2020—2021: Libra and Sky Rojo ===

sentences: Filming began in Madrid in November 2019, and, although the shooting of the series was originally planned to take place in approximately four months, the production of the series was forced to stop and was postponed due to the COVID-19 pandemic starting from March 2020.
section: == Life and career == | === 2020—2021: Libra and Sky Rojo ===

sentences: The pandemic caused the series to stop filming, which also delayed the release of Libra.
section: == Life and career == | === 2020—2021: Libra and Sky Rojo ===

sentences: Before a nation-wide lockdown was established in Argentina, Lali managed to return to the country and go through quarantine in her Buenos Aires house.
section: == Life and career == | === 2020—2021: Libra and Sky Rojo ===

sentences: In November 2020, Lali confessed that, like many of the Sky Rojo staff, she tested positive for COVID-19 between the months of June and November.
section: == Life and career == | === 2020—2021: Libra and Sky Rojo ===

sentences: Sky Rojo, which premiered in March 2021, saw Lali playing Wendy, one of three prostitutes that go on the run in search of freedom while being chased by their pimp and his henchmen.
section: == Life and career == | === 2020—2021: Libra and Sky Rojo ===

sentences: In May 2010, Espósito and her Teen Angels bandmates participated in an action organized by the Biodiversity Foundation on the occasion of the World Biodiversity Day and raised awareness of the importance of preserving biodiversity.

sentences: Espósito has been named "Godmother" of Dono x Vos foundation, a nongovernmental organization dedicated to raising awareness about organ donation.

sentences: Activism =
section: == Other work == | === Activism ===
== Other work == | === Activism ===

sentences: Espósito has proclaimed herself in favor of the voluntary termination of pregnancy in Argentina, where abortion was still illegal at the moment.
section: == Other work == | === Activism ===

sentences: The bill proposed that an abortion may be performed during the first 14 weeks of pregnancy, with no requirements other than the woman's desire.
section: == Other work == | === Activism ===

sentences: Espósito is part of a Feminist group of Argentine actresses and singers, such as Jimena Barón, Griselda Siciliani, Carla Peterson, Florencia Peña and Florencia de la V, among others.
section: == Other work == | === Activism ===

sentences: The bill was approved in 2020.

== Personal life ==

sentences: Personal life ==
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Espósito's nickname and stage name, Lali, was originated by her eldest brother who mispronounced the short form of her name "Mari" as "Lali".
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: She attended primary school and high school at the Colegio San Vicente De Paul in Parque Patricios.
section: == Personal life ==
== Personal life == | === Relationships ===

sentences: Relationships ===
section: == Personal life == | === Relationships ===

sentences: From 2006 to 2010, Espósito was in an on-again, off-again relationship with her Chiquititas and Casi Ángeles co-star Peter Lanzani, whom she called her "first love".
section: == Personal life == | === Relationships ===

sentences: The couple is still a fan favourite in Argentina and they remained good friends after their breakup.
section: == Personal life == | === Relationships ===

sentences: In 2010, Espósito began dating singer and actor Benjamín Amadeo after they met in Casi Ángeles.
section: == Personal life == | === Relationships ===

sentences: Espósito and Amadeo announced their breakup in 2015, but they and their families remained close friends, making several public appearances together.
section: == Personal life == | === Relationships ===

sentences: From late 2015 to early 2016, Espósito was in a highly publicized relationship with her Esperanza Mía co-star Mariano Martinez.
section: == Personal life == | === Relationships ===

sentences: In 2017 Espósito began dating sound engineer Santiago Mocorrea; they broke up in 2020.
section: == Personal life == | === Relationships ===

sentences: As of September 2021, Espósito has won 51 awards from 115 nominations, including Six Gardel Awards, five MTV Europe Music Awards, one Kids' Choice Award, one Heat Latin Music Award, thirteen Argentine Kids' Choice Awards, six MTV Millennial Awards, one Heat Latin Music Award, one Martin Fierro Award, one Billboard Latin Music Awards and one Tato Award.
